content:
atter: It is not important, even
if true, that Yick Wo was married and over fifty years old, but Plessy was
not. To discount or distinguish the precedent, one must show that some dif-
ference between Yick Woand Plessyis important enough to justify reaching
different decisions in these cases. The central question, then, asks which fac-
tors—similarities and differences—domatter. In general, the answer is that a
factor is relevant when it is needed to justify the decision in the precedent.
